description: In this series, Daniel and Tom take you through the "DNA" of Social Engineering. They will look into the history of Social Engineering to see where it began and how it has evolved. They will also discuss the tactics, concepts, and tools used by Social Engineers to elicit information from their targets. They also dive into the psychological component of both the attackers as well as the targets and point to documented examples for illustrative purposes.
name: Social Engineering
subtitle: The art of hacking humans

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom give a general overview of what to expect in the upcoming Social Engineering series. They cover topics like who is the intended audience, what the scope of the series will cover, and what are some specific topics that will be addressed.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom introduce you to the concepts and history of Social Engineering. They begin by defining Social Engineering and then take a look at its beginnings through formal inception as a soft science. They also describe the use of Social Engineering in penetration testing as well as looking to natural social engineers as examples.
episodes.title: Introduction and History

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom continue their discussion of the concepts and history of Social Engineering. They pick back up by going over the different types of social engineers such as sales people, spies, and politicians. They also look into the motivations behind social engineering. Finally, they explore the dark side of social engineering by looking at some of the more famous cases in recent history.
episodes.title: Introduction and History Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom discuss the preliminary tasks and reconnaissance that need to be done in order to plan and organize a social engineering test or attack. They look at the different areas involved including the technical/digital, physical, and social. They also discuss working within the scope of your contract.
episodes.title: Preliminary Tasks and Reconnaissance

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom continue discussing preliminary tasks and reconnaissance for a social engineering test. They pick up by exploring target selection and factors that might help or inhibit your data gathering.
episodes.title: Preliminary Tasks and Reconnaissance Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom explore the art of Elicitation; the ability to get a target to divulge information. This is done through techniques like questioning/questionnaire and communication tactics like rapport building and context matching. They also discuss the goals of elicitation which is answering the Big5 questions (who/what/when/where/why). Also covered are guidelines to follow and possible mistakes to be avoided.
episodes.title: Elicitation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom continue their discussion of Elicitation, starting here by explaining the technique of Preloading. They then discuss what it takes to master the art of elicitation using techniques, self-awareness, and practice.
episodes.title: Elicitation Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom describe the use of Pretexting in a Social Engineering test/attack. They walk you through each of the pretexting stages and elements involved in pretexting. They also use examples to help illustrate what pretexting looks like in action. Finally, they discuss what might play a part of both successful and unsuccessful pretexting.
episodes.title: Pretexting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom examine the psychological components that guide the social engineering test/attack as well as the social engineer themselves and their potential targets. Here they discuss gullibility, fixed action patterns, human behavior and conditioning, the contrast principal, and personal bias.
episodes.title: Psychological Components

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom continue their look into the psychological components of social engineering. Specific topics covered here include Affect Heuristics, Macro and Micro expressions, body language, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming(NLP).
episodes.title: Psychological Components Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom finish their look into the psychological components of social engineering. Specific topics covered here include Rapport building, Brain Overload, Manipulation vs. Influence, and Incentives.
episodes.title: Psychological Components Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom take a look at how Influence plays a part in Social Engineering. Here they look again at communication theory as well as a discussion on framing and frameworks. Other aspects of influence covered include Material Self-Interest, Authority, and "Mental Judo".
episodes.title: Influence

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom continue their discussion of Influence as a Social Engineering tactic. Here they look into influencers such as Commitment, Consistency, Concession, Likability, Exclusivity, Obligation, Reciprocity, Surprise, Scarcity, and Social Proof.
episodes.title: Influence Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom describe and demonstrate some of the tools used by Testers and Attackers alike, that utilize aspects of social engineering. Here they give you an in-depth look at using the Cobalt-Strike tool to gain access to a target's computer through a spear phishing attack.
episodes.title: Tools of the Trade

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom are back with another demo of an attack tool that utilizes social engineering. Here they will show you how to employ the Social Engineering Toolkit to gather social media passwords. Then they delve into the more traditional tools like VoIP Spoofing, Burner Phones, Camera/Spy Camera, GPS, Lock Picking, Audio Recording, and Acting.
episodes.title: Tools of the Trade Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom explain the attack cycle which is the formal planning and implementation of a Social Engineering test/attack which includes assessment, planning, testing, evaluating, and reassessment.
episodes.title: The Attack Cycle

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom finish their Social Engineering series by exploring remediation which are the techniques that will help protect against a Social Engineering attack. They look at implementing user education and counter measures like random testing and evaluation, to help keep the end user ready to recognize an SE attack.
episodes.title: Remediation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Tom wrap up their discussion of Remediation by looking at the Social Engineering Personality Framework. Here they walk you through the Big 5 personality types and explain each type's values and possible attack vectors.
episodes.title: Remediation Part 2
